item.description:
This is an encore performance of Wagnerâ€™s Das Rheingold, a production of the Metropolitan opera directed by Robert Lepage, and originally transmitted live on Sunday October 9, 2010. Conceived by Wagner as a prologue to the Ring cycle, Das Rheingold sets forth the dramatic issues that play out in the three subsequent operas (shown later in the week).

Gold from the depths of the Rhine River is stolen by the dwarf Alberich, who uses it to forge a ring that will give him unlimited power. The theft sets in motion a course of events that will eventually alter the order of the universe. Bryn Terfel as Wotan, lord of the gods, heads the cast.

The broadcast is 2 hours and 50 minutes and I don't know if that includes intermissions. Hopefully there will be time to grab a drink afterwards.

You may want to get advance tickets through Fandango.
